p: The study area covered Brazil, the largest country in Latin America, with a geographical area of 8,510,820 Km 2, in South America. The country is composed of 27 federative units, 26 states and a federal district distributed in five geographic regions: North, Northeast, South, Southeast and Center-West. Its population in the last census in 2010 was 190,755,799 inhabitants. The population estimate for the year 2018 was 208,494,900 inhabitants [ 20].
